abstract: The ethics committee says it will investigate whether Jesse Jackson Jr. broke House rules by publicly campaigning to be appointed to President Obama's former Senate seat.
snippet: The ethics committee says it will investigate whether Jesse Jackson Jr. broke House rules by publicly campaigning to be appointed to President Obama's former Senate seat.
lead_paragraph: The House Ethics Committee, after a two-year delay, has reopened its investigation into whether Representative Jesse Jackson Jr. conducted a "public campaign" in late 2008 to secure an appointment to President Obama's former Senate seat in Illinois, and perhaps broke House rules in the process.

headline.main: House Reopens Case Against Jackson in Blagojevich Case
